short_description: STORM 2000, STORM 4000 and STORM 6000 use LDI Technology (3D LiDAR mapping + Direct AI processor + Imaging) to deliver self-reliant, boundary-free lawn maintenance without RTK, boundary cables or external signals.
long_description: STORM is ideal for private gardens and larger green areas. LDI Technology (3D Laser Mapping + Direct AI processor + Imaging) enables advanced obstacle avoidance and navigation without external systems (RTK/GPS, boundary wire, poles or 4G). STORM anticipates routes and avoids both static and moving obstacles — navigating under tree branches, close to walls, and around shrubs without physical boundaries.
features: Moveable object avoidance (detects obstacles from 1 cm width)
28 cm cutting width; cutting height 3 cm – 8.5 cm
Unlimited cutting zones and flexible no-go zones (via app)
Works completely without RTK/GPS, boundary cables, poles or external signals
limitations: AM ROBOTS reserves the right to approve dealers before dispatch
Dealer approval required for sales in some markets

quick_manual_en.cleaned_text: Quick Start — Lawn pre-cleaning: draw a sketch of your yard and mark charging station, work areas, passages, recharge paths and No-Go zones. Remove debris (branches, toys, wires, stones). Trim lawn to ≤10 cm before first use. Package contents listed: mower, charging station, fixed nails, power adapter, spare blade kit, hex key, cleaning kit, tape, quick start guide, warranty card. Charging station installation: allow 0.5 m each side and 2 m in front; maintain 20 cm distance from a wall when mounted against one. App: search for HOOKII Neomow (Google Play / App Store) and add device. Place STORM on charging station and press & hold ON/OFF to start; HOOKII indicator will turn blue when ready. Button summary: ON/OFF, MOW, HOME, STOP. Follow the Quick Start procedures for safe startup and app mapping.

user_manual_en.cleaned_text: User Manual — Overview & safety: Read manual before use. STORM is LiDAR SLAM based and requires reading safety instructions (general rules, installation, usage, storage, handling). System: mower + charging station + HOOKII Neomow App. Use the App to create maps, set mowing parameters, create No-Go zones and passages, and remotely operate the mower. Installation: prepare lawn (remove obstacles, level holes), choose charging station location with recommended clearances, secure charging station using provided nails or indoor mounting methods. Using STORM: app pairing, map creation, daily mowing, obstacle avoidance, acousto-optic guidance (lights and sound), and maintenance schedule. Maintenance: regular cleaning, consumables replacement, battery care and storage instructions. Troubleshooting and warranty information included. Technical sections (specifications, charging, safety icons) preserved; control-character noise and image references removed for ingestion.
